title: G.C.E. Advanced Level (A/L) - Maths or Commerce Stream
description: A strong background in the Maths stream is preferred for the university degree path. The Commerce stream is also a viable option, especially for diploma-level entry. Strong numerical skills are key.

title: Degree or Diploma in Quantity Surveying
description: The primary pathway is a 4-year BSc (Hons) in Quantity Surveying. Alternatively, a National Diploma (NDT or HNDE) is also a well-recognized entry point into the profession.
institutes: Institute of Technology, University of Moratuwa (ITUM)

title: Junior Quantity Surveyor
description: Work under a senior QS in a construction company or a consultancy firm. You will be involved in taking measurements from drawings, preparing Bills of Quantities (BOQ), and assisting with tender evaluations and monthly payment valuations.

title: Achieve Professional Chartership
description: Gain sufficient experience and pass the professional examinations to become a Chartered Quantity Surveyor. The main professional bodies are the Institute of Quantity Surveyors, Sri Lanka (IQSSL) and the Royal Institution of Chartered Surveyors (RICS, UK).
institutes: N/A - Based on experience and professional exams

title: Senior QS / Commercial Manager
description: Advance to a senior role where you manage the entire commercial aspect of large-scale construction projects. This includes managing contracts, handling claims, and leading a team of junior QSs. Many also become partners in consultancy firms.
